aboutSection.title: Supporting your learning with closeness, motivation and quality
aboutSection.p1: Myker Academy is a centre specialised in English, French and academic support for Primary, Secondary and Baccalaureate (High School). Our goal is to provide a space where every student feels supported, motivated and capable of achieving their academic and language goals.
aboutSection.p2: We believe in a practical, dynamic and personalised teaching approach. That’s why we work with small groups, committed teachers and a methodology that blends real communication, foundational reinforcement and the student’s self-confidence. Whether you're learning English from scratch, improving French, passing maths or recovering a subject, Myker Academy helps you progress step by step with close and effective guidance.
aboutSection.quote: “At Myker Academy we learn with confidence. Our aim is for every student to progress, improve and enjoy the journey.”

items.name: Inés
items.bio: A native French speaker and passionate educator since childhood, Inés has always dreamed of teaching and sharing her knowledge with her students. She loves working with children and enjoys creating a fun, dynamic and friendly atmosphere where they can learn without fear. Languages are her greatest passion, and her energy makes every class special. She is also the person who will assist you personally when you contact us.

items.name: Alex
items.bio: Very popular among younger students, Alex combines teaching with a more active, energetic and sports-oriented approach. He loves engaging with children, motivating them and helping them overcome any academic challenge. His classes are filled with movement, laughter and meaningful learning.

items.name: Mike
items.bio: A native English teacher with extensive experience. Mike stands out for his kindness, empathy and for turning every class into a positive and motivational experience. His main groups are adults, whom he helps with professional English, certification preparation and real communication skills. With him, learning English feels natural and achievable.

items.name: Noa
items.bio: A specialist in early education, Noa has a unique talent for connecting with young children. Her kindness, creativity and patience make students feel so comfortable that they always want to return. Her goal is to help them learn English naturally, through games and confidence-building activities.

items.name: Laia
items.bio: After living in Canada, Laia brings her love for authentic, real-world English. In her classes she shares her international experience through dynamic activities, fun exercises and a practical method that motivates every student. Her approach combines closeness, cultural immersion and genuine learning.

faq.title: We answer your most common questions
faq.subtitle: If you have any other question about schedules, prices, levels or availability, send us a message and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

items.q: How do I know my level?
items.a: We offer a free level test, either online or in person, to assign you to the correct group or recommend the best class type (group or private). In less than 15 minutes we can determine your starting point.

Yes. Group classes require an annual enrollment fee of 30 €, which secures your spot for the entire school year. Additionally, the first month requires a 15 € payment for materials (initial booklet and digital resources). Private classes do not require an enrollment fee.

items.q: Can I make up a missed class?
items.a: Yes. In group classes, make-up options are available whenever there is availability in another group of the same level and age. If no alternative is available that week, we will provide resources so you can keep up with the class.

Yes! We prepare English exams (Cambridge): A2 Key · B1 Preliminary · B2 First · C1 Advanced. French exams: DELF A1–A2–B1–B2 · DALF C1. Other languages on request. Our courses include mock exams, strategies and specific preparation for each exam section.

items.q: Do you offer classes for children, teenagers and adults?
items.a: Yes. At Myker Academy we work with all ages from 5 years old and up. Children (5–11): dynamic groups with natural learning. Teens (12–18): support, languages, certificates and study help. Adults: general English, conversation, exam prep and private lessons. Each group is organised by level and age to ensure an ideal learning environment.

We are available from 9:00 to 20:00. Children & teens: afternoon group classes after school hours. Adults: morning or afternoon depending on availability. Private classes: flexible scheduling (morning/afternoon).

Yes. We offer private lessons with different pricing options: 1 hour: 22 €. 10-hour pack: 200 € (20 €/h). 20-hour pack: 350 € (17.5 €/h). These lessons are personalised, flexible and 100% focused on your goals.
